name: places/ChIJndlJfrZZwokRTCnAxTHwQnM
adrFormatAddress: 312 11th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: A dream turned nightmare. Terribly managed building with rude and unprofessional staff. Troy is the worst manager in Manhattan. We paid our rent on time every month for two years. First Cynthia took our Peloton and said it would be in the gym but she took it home and I had to pay it off. Then when we moved 2 years later they tried to blame us for damage in the elevator with zero proof and waited until we were in another state to tell us they’d keep our entire deposit. Never had a problem with an apartment in our lives. BEWARE. Do not trust this building.

originalText.text: It used to be a great building as it was one of the first high-rises in Hudson Yards. Today it’s the most poorly-managed and under-maintained buildings in the area, where everything is falling apart. Moldy apartments. Negligent administration.

text.text: It used to be a great building as it was one of the first high-rises in Hudson Yards. Today it’s the most poorly-managed and under-maintained buildings in the area, where everything is falling apart. Moldy apartments. Negligent administration.

originalText.text:
0 friends
2 reviews
1.0 star rating 12/8/2016
Lived here for 5 years.
Building was great before Hudson Yards, but not filled with construction noise, blocked views, and a sketchy management + leasing office.
The doormen and other tenants are the best, besides everything is sketchy.

Management is extreme poor, they won't act, they'll just send lousy emails instead. Leasing office is going to try to rip you off by going higher values to rent places which had views back then.

They'll try to get you wherever they can with charges. I tried to stay in the building but leasing director wasted my time instead of helping with my lease and had to move out.

In moving process, they didn't do their pre-move inspection, came with really fake charges upto $4k even though the place was pristine after 5 years. They even tried to execute an unsigned move out document. That's how low they can go to scam you last minute even you pay a premium rent over years.

The building is on a huge decline because of construction around, as well as lots of new buildings coming out next door, so they're trying to scam people to make the most of it. STAY AWAY!

originalText.text: A very contemporary apartment with all the amenities of a hotel without that hotel vibe. You can find spacious studios here with the alcove style layout that gives the feel of a one bedroom, at a studio price. Views overlook the Hudson River and give a lot of light into the apartment itself. Although the area is up and coming, for this price point, nothing else comes close.

originalText.text: I lived there for almost 3 years... I miss NYC so badly. Building was great at the time (from 2013 to 2015), staff was amazing, the convenience store was open 24 hours... only good memories, great location - close to the river park, Chelsea, Highline. A lot of good memories. Please consider the review is based on the time I lived there, from 2013-2015.
